intro: Melampodium cupulatum, commonly known as the cupuliferum or the crowncup, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with hairy, upright stems that often branch near the base. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with red centers, which bloom from summer to fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Melampodium cupulatum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
